oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Board of aid sign and WWI bond poster
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of a sign and poster hanging outside of the Board of Aid office in Rugby. On left is a sign that reads: "Board of Aid to Land Ownership Limited," and the poster on right features a soldier with the text "And they thought we couldn't fight / Victory, Liberty, Loan." The poster is by American artist Victor Clyde Forsythe.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: War posters; Signs (Notices)
